verses.verse: "Man, <WH120> who is born <WH3205> of a woman, <WH802> is of few <WH7116> days, <WH3117> and full <WH7649> of trouble. <WH7267>
He comes forth <WH3318> like a flower, <WH6731> and is cut down. <WH5243> He also flees <WH1272> like a shadow, <WH6738> and doesn't <WH5975> continue.
Do you open <WH6491> your eyes <WH5869> on such a one, <WH2088> and bring <WH935> me into judgment with you? <WH4941>
Who can bring <WH5414> a clean <WH2889> thing out of an unclean? <WH2931> Not one. <WH259>
Seeing <WH518> his days <WH3117> are determined, <WH2782> the number <WH4557> of his months <WH2320> is with you, <WH6213> and you have appointed his bounds <WH2706> that he can't <WH5674> pass;
Look <WH8159> away from him, <WH2308> that he may rest, until he shall accomplish, <WH7521> as a hireling, <WH7916> his day. <WH3117>
"For there is <WH3426> hope <WH8615> for a tree, <WH6086> If it is cut down, <WH3772> that it will sprout again, <WH2498> that the tender branch <WH3127> of it will not cease. <WH2308>
Though its root <WH8328> grows old <WH2204> in the earth, <WH776> and its stock <WH1503> dies <WH4191> in the ground, <WH6083>
yet through the scent <WH7381> of water <WH4325> it will bud, <WH6524> and put forth <WH6213> boughs <WH7105> like a plant. <WH5194>
But man <WH1397> dies, <WH4191> and is laid low. <WH2522> Yes, <WH120> man gives up the spirit, <WH1478> and where is he?
As the waters <WH4325> fail <WH235> from the sea, <WH3220> and the river <WH5104> wastes <WH2717> and dries up, <WH3001>
so man <WH376> lies down <WH7901> and doesn't <WH6965> rise. Until the heavens <WH8064> are no more, <WH1115> they shall not awake, <WH6974> nor be roused out <WH5782> of their sleep. <WH8142>

"Oh that <WH5414> you would hide <WH6845> me in Sheol, <WH7585> that you would keep me secret, <WH5641> until your wrath <WH639> is past, <WH7725> that you would appoint <WH7896> me a set time, <WH2706> and remember me! <WH2142>
If a man <WH1397> dies, <WH4191> shall he live <WH2421> again? <WH3117> All the days of my warfare <WH6635> would I wait, <WH3176> until my release <WH2487> should come. <WH935>
You would call, <WH7121> and I would answer <WH6030> you. <WH3700> You would have a desire to the work <WH4639> of your hands. <WH3027>
But now you number <WH5608> my steps. <WH6806> Don't <WH8104> you watch over my sin? <WH2403>
My disobedience <WH6588> is sealed up <WH2856> in a bag. <WH6872> You fasten up <WH2950> my iniquity. <WH5771>
"But <WH199> the mountain <WH2022> falling <WH5307> comes to nothing. <WH5034> The rock <WH6697> is removed <WH6275> out of its place; <WH4725>
The waters <WH4325> wear <WH7833> the stones. <WH68> The torrents of it wash away <WH7857> the <WH5599> dust <WH6083> of the earth. <WH776> So you destroy <WH6> the hope <WH8615> of man. <WH582>
You forever <WH5331> prevail <WH8630> against him, <WH1980> and he departs. You change <WH8138> his face, <WH6440> and send him away. <WH7971>
His sons <WH1121> come to honor, <WH3513> and he doesn't <WH3045> know it. <WH6819> They are brought low, but he doesn't <WH995> perceive it of them.
But his flesh <WH1320> on him has pain, <WH3510> and his soul <WH5315> inside him mourns. <WH56>"
